poem:
Title: "In Pursuit of Silence"

To trumpet or to mute - a beguiling dance,
In the arena of the accused, he takes his stance,
Arraigned in New York, his empire in disarray,
A hushed storm, in dollars doled, holds sway.
No guilt, exclaims the titan in shuttered sun,
Yet even shadows converse when day is done.
Impending verdicts whisper truths, unsparingly resounding,
In the twilight of prominence, justice is accounting.
